bibl.title: Letter from Ida E. and John R. Kissinger to Philip Showalter Hench, December 23, 1944

div1.p: Ida Kissinger sends her husband's identifications of the persons in a photograph. She discusses their health problems.

div1.head: Letter from Ida E. and John R. Kissinger to Philip Showalter Hench, December 23, 1944
div1.opener:
12,23,44. 810 Turner St
Clear Water, Fla.
Philip. S. Hench,
Dear, Dr. Hench,
div1.p:
your, letter. of
12:16.44 just received We Were more
Pleased,
Than I. can tell you yes I strongly believe
in mental, Telepathy. We are Very much
grieved over your dear, Mothers, Illness
John felt Very badly and lived over
It, he, Said she was so devoted to you. We
both loved her after We had Vissited at
your Home and talk of the Wonderful.
time we had With your family While
in. Rochester, the little boy is Study
a lovely healthy looking, little fellow
and We love the name of John. how
nice he arrived on your fathers. birth
day. It. is. to. had. our Ancestors Cannot
be here to enjoy their My daughter is
living., here, her daughter, and her
daughter. Makes four generations of
girls all being the first in the family
My Parents and Bro & Sister are all.
Ac
Ki
gone I have one Aunt Who is. 94, on
Christmas day she fell a year ago
broke her hip but she canot Sit
up at all. She is all my Relatives
now John is getting along seal Well
and his Boils are growing less they
Trouble me Much as They do him for
he Wants me to look at than all the time
he is Very, Nervious and I. am. to
I have Rheumatism in my Hands
and My Right hip. I am not Doc, at
all far It is only Grandmother. Chindisu
John and I are both Very glad to Know
you have Such a Splendid affectivity
It do your life Work. I Know your
dear Mother Was Very Happy over
the fact that you are so famous
a, Dr. and our Prayers Will be
With you: now as for, those, Pictures
I am Sending then to you and Named
in the Picture as John, Remembers
(1) PrT. William, Olson,
(2), Dr. Cook,
(3), Prt. Sontag,
(4), AcT. Hospital, Steward John R Kissinger
(5), Frank, M, Dawley
(6), Prt, Clyde, West,
(7), John, J, Moran, discharged Act.
Hospital Steward
(8), Adolph: Springer,
(9), Edward, Weatherwalk. { in, doubt
Tens,
(10) The Psnec one 'Elmegraut, Volunteers

The. Boys near Dr. Cook and one near
Springer, are Major, Starks two boys
the other a Playmate this Group-
was not taken on the grounds' of.
Camp- Lazear. but on the out Skirts
of It,, I do hope this is so you Can
read It if there is anything else
you have and Would like us
to help- We Will be glad I, have-
Ac
Ki
Rheumatism in my hands and Knees
quite bad but can manage to Write
Some We both Send Our love to your
family and do hope there Will not
be anything to Mar your Christmas
We Will be alone,,but I thank
God I . have John With me. and
I Know he, is Satisfied I am
With him, for he does not Want
me out of Sight Will be glad if
this is Satisfactory to you.

So Good night and May
God Bless us All.

Mrs John R Kissinger
John, R.

now, Dr, Hench 'I have Wrote just as'
John Told me if you can get It I
Will be glad ' the Wands: May be Spelled, Wrong,
the Barracks, is Camp- Lazear: but is
not Havana Cuba:{ but is. Massinol
and Yramadas' Cuba}.

I May not have there Spelled right
but, you Will Know What they are,
the Picture of the Ambulance ; Group-
Was Taken the lake- Part of .Jan. and.
Was' only a short time before. they left
for Home on , frslough. and John. J, Moran'
Was acting Hospital Steward but Was'
discharged before this Was Taken and he
Could not Wear a Uniform ' but had
a Civilian Suit-

You ask if I Would like Some more of
than. Hyegeia, Yes I Would love to have
then about, 50, no Many ask me far
then, if Its, Possible to pit them
Ac
Ki
We do not Care for Florida and
you may come to See us in the North
We are, real, Happy, together, of Course
I have to Humor, John a lot of
things When he gets to up Set I , read
as atract his attention, some other
Way 44 year We are, together We dont
have any, Luxuries, on 125 a Month but
We dont go Hungry like We did at one
time, It rather Cool here down to 23
the Vegetables gardens are Rined and Pseiss
here like most Places one Very High
I have a lady friend visiting me from
Indiana We hope' not a thing Will Mar
Your christmas and hope to hear from
you Very Soon.

So With our love and Kindest
regard to you and your. family

signed.unclear:
John, R.
Mrs John, R. Kissinger
